answers.answer: Hi,How are you? What other symptoms are present? A constantly full bladder triggers frequent urination or a constant dribbling of urine, or both. This may be due to bladder muscle weakness which may be a result of nerve damage from diabetes or other diseases;  when the urethra is blocked due to kidney or urinary stones; tumors; an enlarged prostate in men, or a birth defect. If it persists, it is best that you have this checked by your doctor for proper evaluation. Direct clinical examination and additional diagnostic tests may also be done .Take care and do keep us posted.

title: droops after pee
